diagnosis.primary: Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS), High Grade, with microinvasion (<1mm)
diagnosis.receptorStatus: ER Positive, PR Positive, HER2 Negative
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Lumpectomy + Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy (02/15/2025) by Dr. Carter

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) - Whole Breast RT (WBRT)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing the entire left breast tissue (PTV_Breast_Prone).
medications: Topical Creams (e.g., Calendula, Hydrocortisone) PRN skin reaction
Adjuvant Endocrine Therapy (e.g., Anastrozole) - Managed by Med Onc/Surgeon

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Patient positioned prone on dedicated prone breast board, allowing left breast to be isolated. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Tattoos placed for alignment per protocol. Wires on scar/breast borders.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired in prone position to optimize dose distribution and spare heart/lung tissue. Patient tolerated position well.

dosimetry.constraints: Heart Max < 5 Gy; Ips Lng V20Gy < 10%
dosimetry.planNotes: Hypofractionated WBRT prone setup to minimize dose to OARs given patient anatomy.

fractions.setupNotes: Patient setup prone on breast board. Alignment verified with kV imaging.
fractions.sideEffects: Minimal skin pinkness (Grade 1), mostly inferior aspect. No significant fatigue.

imagingAndReports.summary: Suspicious pleomorphic calcifications L breast LIQ, BI-RADS 4c.
DCIS, High Grade, comedonecrosis present. Microinvasion cannot be excluded. ER+ noted.
2.5cm DCIS, High Grade. Foci of microinvasion (<1mm). Margins negative (>2mm). 0/3 SN positive. ER/PR+, HER2-.
Non-contrast CT acquired in prone position on dedicated prone breast board.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Helen Carter (Surgeon)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ biopsy-proven high grade DCIS. Discussed surgical options. Plan for lumpectomy + SLNB. Need for post-op RT likely.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Helen Carter (Surgeon)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p L Lumpectomy + SLNB. Path: DCIS+mi, pN0(sn), margins neg. Refer to Rad Onc for adjuvant WBRT. Start Anastrozole after RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ pTis(mi) pN0 L BC s/p BCS. Discussed adjuvant WBRT. Given pt's anatomy (large, pendulous breasts), discussed benefits of prone positioning (reduced skin fold dose, potential lung/heart sparing). Recommended prone WBRT 42.56Gy/16fx. Pt understands and agrees. Prone CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: RTT/Simulation Staff
progressNotes.summary: Patient simulated on prone breast board. Tolerated position well. Setup instructions documented. CT scan obtained.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 5/16 fx in prone position. Reports setup is comfortable. Minimal skin pinkness (Grade 1), mostly inferior aspect. No significant fatigue. Continue RT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant therapy to reduce risk of local recurrence after lumpectomy.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Skin reaction (redness, dryness, peeling), fatigue, breast swelling/tenderness. Explained that prone position helps reduce skin reaction in the inframammary fold and minimizes lung/heart dose.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Skin care (gentle washing, moisturizers), managing fatigue, reporting significant skin breakdown or pain. Comfort and stillness in the prone position.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, perform skin care, report symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use topical creams as directed. Follow instructions for starting endocrine therapy after RT.

cptCharges.description: Simulation, Intermediate / Complex (Prone setup may increase complexity)
Treatment device, Intermediate / Complex (Prone breast board)
Special treatment procedure (May sometimes be billed for complex prone setup/planning)
